result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

9-7-22 minutes and bond form emailed to DCJ
Dane County Pretrial Services Referral

CASH BOND SET - $500.00 PER CASE 
Cash bond is set in the amount of $500 (per case). If the defendant posts cash bail, the defendant must report to and comply with Pretrial Services. The defendant shall report to Pretrial Services by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. 
The following checked category(s) are also ordered: __ GPS, _X_ Remote Breath (Alcohol) Monitoring, and/or _X_ Random Drug Testing. 
NONCOMPLIANCE WILL BE REPORTED BY DCPS TO THE JUDICIARY WHO SHALL RESPOND IN ONE OF THESE WAYS: Schedule bail hearing, Increase Supervision, Issue warrant, No change but monitor. 
- Defendant shall complete the booking/fingerprinting process if required. 
- Defendant shall not consume or possess alcohol. 
- Defendant shall not use/possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription. 
- Defendant shall not access social media. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with MEB, AJG, or KRS. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with any juvenile. 
Parties did not stipulate to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing. 
Trial Judge - Br 17

Court reporter Paige Reardon. Defendant Erin R Shelby in court.  Attorney Nancy L. Moore in court for Erin R Shelby.  Attorney Lillian Nelson in place of John D Rice in court for State of Wisconsin. In court for a bail review for multiple pretrial services violations. State requests $1000 cash bail. Atty Moore makes argument. Court makes findings and imposes a $500 cash bond. ALL OTHER BOND CONDITIONS REMAIN THE SAME. Defendant taken into custody.

Reporter:  Patrick Weishan
  Defendant advised of right to and waived Preliminary Hearing (Preliminary Hearing Waiver signed); Court accepted waiver of Preliminary Hearing and ordered case bound over.
Atty Nancy Moore
Referral to Dane County Pretrial Services (DCPS)
Preliminary hearing on June 29, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
The Court ordered a signature bond on the condition that the defendant reports to and complies with Pretrial Services. The defendant shall report by (date) TODAY at (time) 2:00 PM. 
The following checked category(s) are also ordered: __ GPS, _x_ Remote Breath (Alcohol) Monitoring, and/or _x_ Random Drug Testing. 
NONCOMPLIANCE WILL BE REPORTED BY DCPS TO THE JUDICIARY WHO SHALL RESPOND IN ONE OF THESE WAYS: Schedule bail hearing, Increase Supervision, Issue warrant, No change but monitor. 
- Defendant shall complete the booking/fingerprinting process if required. 
- Defendant shall not consume or possess alcohol. 
- Defendant shall not use/possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription. 
- Defendant shall not access social media. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with MEB, AJG, or KRS. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with any juvenile. 
Parties did not stipulate to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing. 
Trial Judge - Br 17

10:58 AM Defendant appeared.  Colleen Lennon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
